item.title: Unlock! Structure and Accessibility
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
Accessibility can be a confusing topic, but we can start by looking to UCSF standards and expectations to get a sense of where to focus our efforts. If we’re talking about web content, using platforms (e.g. Moodle, WordPress, Zendesk, LibApps, etc.) that are build with accessibility in mind whenever possible really ...

Read moreUnlock! Structure and Accessibility

item.title: Library Website Accessibility
item.dc:creator: Richard Trott
item.description:
Celebrate Global Accessibility Awareness Day by watching a recording of Michele’s portion of our accessibility interest group meeting, which coincidentally took place today. Michele briefly reviewed the current status of accessibility on a few of the Library’s websites and also talked about a few things she’s discovered lately to help ...

Read moreLibrary Website Accessibility

item.title: External Link Behavior Change
item.dc:creator: Richard Trott
item.description:
To improve website usability and accessibility, we’re changing how external links open. The links will no longer open in a new window or tab by default. Right now, links to our own websites open within the same window (and tab), but external links open in a new window (or tab). ...

Read moreExternal Link Behavior Change

item.title: Accessibility and the Library Website
item.dc:creator: Richard Trott
item.description:
I recently received some comments about the Library website’s accessibility, and it seemed like a good time to disseminate information about this important initiative more widely. What is Accessibility? In Web Accessibility for Everyone, Laura Kalbag defines web accessibility as the “degree to which a website is usable by as ...

Read moreAccessibility and the Library Website

item.title: Entrance Redesign Project Update
item.dc:creator: Chris Shaffer
item.description:
The Entrance Redesign Project has been a long and complex process and that will continue as we move into 2019. There has been a lot of work behind the scenes to plan for this major transition. With any major project come unexpected changes. Recently, EVCP Dan Lowenstein informed me that ...

item.title: Off the Shelf is getting an update
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
Off the Shelf is starting to show its age a bit, so next week it will be getting a much needed refresh. The look and feel will be updated to a more current design using the UCSF color palette, and the posts will be easier to read on whatever size ...

item.title: Website Tune-up
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
Just a heads up to let everyone know that some website changes are scheduled to go live early tomorrow morning July 20. This will affect the primary Library site at https://www.library.ucsf.edu./ The tune-up mostly concerns under-the-hood changes, but those will result in improvements to areas which directly impact our users: ...
